skill.name: brand-guidelines
skill.description: Applies Anthropic's official brand colors and typography to any sort of artifact that may benefit from having Anthropic's look-and-feel. Use it when brand colors or style guidelines, visual formatting, or company design standards apply.
skill.summary: Applies Anthropic's official brand colors and typography to any sort of artifact that may benefit fr...
skill.author: Anthropic

security_audit.summary: Official Anthropic skill containing only brand guidelines documentation with colors, typography, and styling rules. No executable code or security concerns.

content.value_statement: Automatically applies Anthropic's official brand colors, typography, and visual identity to presentations, documents, and artifacts for consistent professional styling.
actual_capabilities: Applies Anthropic's official color palette (dark #141413, light #faf9f5, accents orange/blue/green)
Automatically styles headings with Poppins font (24pt+)
Applies Lora font to body text with system fallbacks
Applies accent colors to non-text shapes (cycling through orange, blue, green)
Smart color selection based on background for optimal contrast
Maintains text hierarchy and formatting while applying brand styles
limitations: Best results require Poppins and Lora fonts pre-installed in system
Falls back to Arial/Georgia if custom fonts unavailable
Designed specifically for Anthropic brand (not customizable for other brands)
Focuses on visual styling rather than content generation

use_cases.title: Brand-Compliant Presentations
use_cases.description: Apply Anthropic's official colors and typography to PowerPoint presentations for consistent corporate identity
use_cases.target_user: Marketing teams, product managers, executives creating presentations

use_cases.title: Document Styling
use_cases.description: Automatically format documents with Anthropic's brand guidelines including proper fonts and color schemes
use_cases.target_user: Content creators, technical writers, business analysts

use_cases.title: Visual Artifact Post-Processing
use_cases.description: Apply brand styling to generated charts, diagrams, and visual content for professional appearance

prompt_templates.title: Style a Presentation
prompt_templates.prompt: Apply Anthropic brand guidelines to this presentation, using proper colors and typography
prompt_templates.scenario: When you have a draft presentation that needs brand-compliant styling

prompt_templates.title: Brand Color Consultation
prompt_templates.prompt: What are Anthropic's official brand colors and when should I use each?
prompt_templates.scenario: When you need to understand the brand color palette for design work

prompt_templates.title: Typography Guidelines
prompt_templates.prompt: What fonts and typography rules should I follow for Anthropic-branded content?
prompt_templates.scenario: When creating text-heavy content that needs to match brand standards

output_examples.output: Anthropic's accent colors are: Orange (#d97757) as primary accent, Blue (#6a9bcc) as secondary accent, and Green (#788c5d) as tertiary accent. These should be used for highlighting, call-to-actions, and visual interest while maintaining brand consistency.

output_examples.input: Apply brand styling to my presentation
output_examples.output: I'll apply Anthropic's brand guidelines: headings will use Poppins font in dark (#141413), body text will use Lora font, backgrounds will use light (#faf9f5) or light gray (#e8e6dc), and shapes will cycle through the accent colors (orange, blue, green).

best_practices: Pre-install Poppins and Lora fonts in your environment for optimal results
Use the skill when creating client-facing or public Anthropic materials
Apply to presentations, documents, and visual artifacts consistently
Reference the guidelines when manually creating designs to maintain brand consistency
Use dark (#141413) for primary text and light (#faf9f5) for backgrounds as the foundation
Reserve accent colors (orange, blue, green) for highlights and visual interest
anti_patterns: Don't modify the official brand colors or create custom variations
Avoid mixing Anthropic brand with other company brands in the same artifact
Don't use this skill for non-Anthropic branded materials
Avoid overusing accent colors - they should accent, not dominate
Don't skip font installation and rely solely on fallbacks for important materials

faq.question: What if I don't have Poppins and Lora fonts installed?
faq.answer: The skill automatically falls back to Arial for headings and Georgia for body text if the custom fonts aren't available. However, for best brand consistency, pre-install both fonts in your system.

faq.question: When should I use each accent color?
faq.answer: Orange (#d97757) is the primary accent for main highlights and CTAs, Blue (#6a9bcc) is secondary for supporting elements, and Green (#788c5d) is tertiary for additional visual variety. The skill cycles through them automatically for shapes.

faq.question: Can I customize these guidelines for my own brand?
faq.answer: No, this skill is specifically designed for Anthropic's brand identity. It applies Anthropic's exact colors, typography, and styling rules and isn't customizable for other brands.

faq.question: What file types does this work with?
faq.answer: The skill works with various artifact types that support styling, particularly PowerPoint presentations (via python-pptx), documents, and visual content where brand guidelines apply.
